content.description: First, figure out where you're getting off the rock (lowering from huge flake on east end works with a folded pad below).Start on two side-by-side good edges and head straight up the face.Problem #397 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P2.
content.protection: 2 pads: 1 for the climb, 1 for the descent (or 1 pad + friend to move pad)
content.location: North face between two small boulders on the first large boulder when approaching from Wash Boulders.

content.description: First, figure out where you're getting off the rock (lowering from huge flake on east end works with a folded pad below).Sit start at a thin chunky vertical crack just left of a pine and follow it to the top.Problem #396 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P1.
content.protection: 2 pads: 1 for the climb, 1 for the descent (or 1 pad + friend to move pad)
content.location: West face between a small boulder and pine on the first large boulder when approaching from Wash Boulders.

content.description: Start near a vertical crack in the middle of the face (has a plant growing in it) at a sidepull and head straight up just left of the crack (crack is on) to a huge hueco above the lip.Problem #395 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P1.
On the right side of the east face, follow nice flakes angling up left (more just keep appearing!)Problem #394 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P2.
content.protection: Stepped landing, a folded second pad is helpful to support the main landing pad

content.description: Numerous freestanding boulders from big to huge on the slope below Main Wall, plus one bonus boulder down near the wash with numerous moderates.
